text: It does feel like "Dark Side of the Moon" era Pink Floyd, but it actually reminds me of Tame Impala. I think the "synth" sound and the drum beat are what make me think of them. How cool would Tame Impala covering the Plok sondtrack sound!?

author: flamingwoodz

text: I remember making him either pause or just make PLOK sit there doing nothing so that I could get all the music without any sound effects...  man I've been holding onto that tape for all these years & with all the plays & use, the high end of the EQ has obviously worn down a bit & even boosting it back up with an exterior EQ these days, it still doesn't sound as crisp as these YouTUBE videos! But close... Anyways, THANX for posting these PLOK! jams!!!
author: QUIZFILTER

text: I immediately snatched up one of his dad's nearby high-quality cassette tapes, popped it into his high-quality cassette tape recorder that was hooked up to the TV/cable/laser-disc(LOL) player/insanely high-quality BETA recorder/& of course... SNES &b proceeded to record every single different track of music that came on as my friend played...
author: QUIZFILTER

text: This game had some of the most amazing music!!!  ( as if you guys aren't already aware! )   I remember renting this game back in the mid 90s & as soon as my friend & I turned it on, we looked at each other & said WOW!!

author: Brookie Smallz

text: Finally a clean copy of this song without the screwed up emulation. The beginning part definitely creeps you out and fitting for the creepy forest level (not so much for the flea pit levels). The chill, almost gangsta beat that drops at 1:00 just threw me off when I first heard it, like dammmmnn. Then it jumps back to creepy mode, with organs blazing. Another great track out of many for Plok. I still have the old SNES cartridge.
